Package ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.plugin.action

Class ActionCommand<A extends Action>

java.lang.Object
ca.on.oicr.gsi.shesmu.plugin.action.ActionCommand<A>
Type Parameters:
A - the action that should receive this command
public abstract class ActionCommand<A extends Action> extends Object
Perform an action-specific command

Commands are a way for a user to provide specific direction to actions. This is meant to provide a way to adjust an action's behaviour at runtime. Actions may receive invalid or inappropriate commands and should simply ignore them.

  • Constructor Details

    • ActionCommand

      public ActionCommand(Class<A> clazz, String command, FrontEndIcon icon, String buttonText, ActionCommand.Preference... preferences)
      Define a new command
      Parameters:
      clazz - the action class on which this command is performed
      command - an identifier for this command; although the implementation is unique to this action type, this can be shared across different action types for bulk actions
      icon - the icon that should appear in the UI
      buttonText - the text that should appear in the UI
      preferences - UI settings for this command

      Execute a command on an action
      Parameters:
      action - the action to perform the command on
      user - the user performing this action, if known
      Returns:
      an indication of whether the command was followed and if the processor needs to change the action's state
